channel.title: Cowboy Shaman
channel.description: A comforting voice providing spiritual support, laughter, love, & guidance.
channel.itunes:subtitle: "Focus on what you want, not what you don't-want."
channel.itunes:author: Cowboy Shaman
channel.itunes:summary: A comforting voice providing spiritual support, laughter, love, & guidance.

item.title: 093 - End of the World
item.description:
Oh, my God, it's happening—the end of the world!

The Mayans predicted it so it must be true. We're doomed, DOOMED!

No.
Stop.
You've got it all wrong.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Oh, my God, it's happening—the end of the world! The Mayans predicted it so it must be true. We're doomed, DOOMED! No.Stop.You've got it all wrong. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 092 - One of These Days…
item.description:
How many of you have a list inside your head of:

"Things you want to do as soon as you can find the time to do these things you've wanted to do for quite some time now"?

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: How many of you have a list inside your head of: "Things you want to do as soon as you can find the time to do these things you've wanted to do for quite some time now"? www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 091 - Your Ideal Companion
item.description:
Everyone wants to live-in-love with their ideal companion, right? Everyone wants to enjoy a fulfilling lifetime with the man or woman of their dreams. What could be better than that?

Thing is, there's a very important part—a crucial part—of this "finding one another" scenario that few folks know about.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 090 - One Cup of God
item.description:
We come into this world in various forms. All of us—we're all different. And that's good. The world thrives on this diversity!

But did you know this?

There is a way we're all alike.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: We come into this world in various forms. All of us—we're all different. And that's good. The world thrives on this diversity! But did you know this? There is a way we're all alike. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 089 - Fun, Fun, Fun
item.description:
No matter who you are in this lifetime, no matter where you live or how much money you have (or don't), or how much schooling you have (or don't) —or whatever you think is important (or don't) — if you want to succeed — you have to …

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: No matter who you are in this lifetime, no matter where you live or how much money you have (or don't), or how much schooling you have (or don't) —or whatever you think is important (or don't) — if you want to succeed — you have to … www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 088 - I Believe You Already Know This
item.description:
"Your mind catches up to what you already know."

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: "Your mind catches up to what you already know." www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 087 - Appreciation Meditation
item.description:
How do we escape from the anger and sadness of this world we're reminded of each and every moment of our lives and re-emerge into that place where we want to be, that we long to be, that best serves us and helps us to best-serve?

Actually, it's easy. Listen.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: How do we escape from the anger and sadness of this world we're reminded of each and every moment of our lives and re-emerge into that place where we want to be, that we long to be, that best serves us and helps us to best-serve? Actually, it's easy. Listen. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 086 - Would've, Could've, Should've
item.description:
You remember what they say about history, right?

That, if you don't remember it, if you don't learn from it, you're bound to repeat it.

It appears we have that same issue with the phrase: Would-a, could-a, should-a

http://www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: You remember what they say about history, right? That, if you don't remember it, if you don't learn from it, you're bound to repeat it. It appears we have that same issue with the phrase: Would-a, could-a, should-a http://www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 085 - Now I Lay Me Down to Sleep
item.description:
It's all over the news these days…the fact that people—everywhere—are having a tough time going to sleep at night.

Radio & TV shows discuss the problem—newspaper & magazine articles offer helpful hints—but there's one important point these sources rarely talk about.

And it's probably the most-important thing we should all be doing before drifting off to dreamland.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: It's all over the news these days…the fact that people—everywhere—are having a tough time going to sleep at night. Radio & TV shows discuss the problem—newspaper & magazine articles offer helpful hints—but there's one important point these sources rarely talk about. And it's probably the most-important thing we should all be doing before drifting off to dreamland.

item.title: 084 - Babysitting
item.description:
Any child with younger siblings has had to watch over these little ones at some point in their lives.

And even if you're an only child, surely, at some time in your past, you were given the responsibility of watching over someone else's younger ones.

It's called babysitting. Taking care of youngsters, attending to them, making sure they're okay.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 083 - Build an Altar - Part 2
item.description:
Last week we spoke of the importance of building your own altar.

It doesn't have to be as spectacular as altars one might encounter in cathedrals, mosques, synagogues, or temples - but it should be special - a sacred place that beckons one to be quiet, reverent.

Listen to what else these holy places in our homes can accomplish.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Last week we spoke of the importance of building your own altar. It doesn't have to be as spectacular as altars one might encounter in cathedrals, mosques, synagogues, or temples - but it should be special - a sacred place that beckons one to be quiet, reverent. Listen to what else these holy places in our homes can accomplish.

item.title: 082 - Build an Altar - Part 1
item.description:
Throughout all these talks of ours, we've mentioned many things that are worth incorporating into our lives in order to assist us in being all that we can be.

"Focus on what you want, not what you don't-want."

Meditation is beneficial.

And here's something else.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Throughout all these talks of ours, we've mentioned many things that are worth incorporating into our lives in order to assist us in being all that we can be. "Focus on what you want, not what you don't-want." Meditation is beneficial. And here's something else.

item.title: 081 - Stupid Toe
item.description:
We're one; we're all one.

We're not separate, we're not different.

But can we really get our heads around that concept?
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: We're one; we're all one. We're not separate, we're not different. But can we really get our heads around that concept?

item.title: 080 - I Love You
item.description:
The word love is tossed around so much these days that it's lost much of its shine, its meaning, its, well…

the meaning we always hoped it would mean when we said it and meant it.

Now, it's everywhere—spouted constantly.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 079 - Smile Within
item.description:
Most of the spiritual teachings recommend learning a form of meditation.

Being prayerful
Being mindful.
Being quiet and still.

Here's a simple method you might enjoy.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Most of the spiritual teachings recommend learning a form of meditation. Being prayerfulBeing mindful.Being quiet and still. Here's a simple method you might enjoy.

item.title: 078 - A Gift
item.description:
Out of all the stuff I've learned from my spiritual teachers,

I wanted to figure out:

What's the most important piece of advice I could give to you.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Out of all the stuff I've learned from my spiritual teachers, I wanted to figure out: What's the most important piece of advice I could give to you.

item.title: 077 - Remember Who You Are
item.description:
In the children's book, "Mrs. Pennybutton—Teacher of Souls", she reminds her students that, once they are born, once they are living here on Earth, it's quite important to:

"Remember who you are".

(who you really are)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: In the children's book, "Mrs. Pennybutton—Teacher of Souls", she reminds her students that, once they are born, once they are living here on Earth, it's quite important to: "Remember who you are". (who you really are)

item.title: 076 - What Did You Expect
item.description: The Divine-Whatever is always listening to what you say, hearing what words you use, feeling what feelings you feel, seeing what pictures you're painting in your mind—and then—doing its darnedest to give you exactly what you're putting out there.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: The Divine-Whatever is always listening to what you say, hearing what words you use, feeling what feelings you feel, seeing what pictures you're painting in your mind—and then—doing its darnedest to give you exactly what you're putting out there.

item.title: 075- Hurry Worry
item.description:
Let's say that the following is true; let's say this is how life works.

Every morning, when we awake, we either have a full tank of energy to expend—or—a big stack of money to spend.

Choose the image that works best for you.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Let's say that the following is true; let's say this is how life works. Every morning, when we awake, we either have a full tank of energy to expend—or—a big stack of money to spend. Choose the image that works best for you. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 074 - Create Space
item.description:
Most spiritual teachings suggest incorporating a form of meditation into your daily ritual.

A time to go within.
A time to communicate with Spirit.
A time to receive guidance from a power greater than yourself.

And the BEST way to meditate? Well, it must be YOUR way to meditate.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Most spiritual teachings suggest incorporating a form of meditation into your daily ritual.A time to go within.A time to communicate with Spirit.A time to receive guidance from a power greater than yourself. And the BEST way to meditate? Well, it must be YOUR way to meditate. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 073 - Just Float
item.description:
It must be in the water.

This message popped into my consciousness several times this week. It may have appeared to you, too, in some form or another.

Heck, I hope it's poppin' up for everyone, everywhere.

As I said, it must be in the water.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: It must be in the water. This message popped into my consciousness several times this week. It may have appeared to you, too, in some form or another. Heck, I hope it's poppin' up for everyone, everywhere. As I said, it must be in the water.

item.title: 072 - Why Wait Till Spring?
item.description:
I opened the door to my storage unit.

You know, that place where you put all those things you want to save but don't have room for in your house, so you rent this 'other little house' so you can store those things you want to save but have no room for in your house? 

Then it hit me:

"Why am I saving all of this stuff?"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: I opened the door to my storage unit. You know, that place where you put all those things you want to save but don't have room for in your house, so you rent this 'other little house' so you can store those things you want to save but have no room for in your house?  Then it hit me: "Why am I saving all of this stuff?"

item.title: 071 - That Rule That's Golden
item.description:
Some of the most powerful pieces of guidance the world has ever known can be summed up in just a few words, sentences, phrases.

Words and phrases, simple in nature, easy-to-understand.

But BECAUSE they're simple in nature, and easy-to-understand, we pay no attention to this knowledge being shared.  Instead, we believe,

"Ah. c'mon, that'd NEVER work!"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Some of the most powerful pieces of guidance the world has ever known can be summed up in just a few words, sentences, phrases. Words and phrases, simple in nature, easy-to-understand. But BECAUSE they're simple in nature, and easy-to-understand, we pay no attention to this knowledge being shared.  Instead, we believe, "Ah. c'mon, that'd NEVER work!"

item.title: 070 - Listen
item.description:
Everyone's racing to find the ideal gift for everyone on their list this holiday season.

But you have to know what the person likes, what they don't like, what they've asked for, what size they require, what colors, what brands… (whew!)

Know the best gift you can give someone?

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Everyone's racing to find the ideal gift for everyone on their list this holiday season. But you have to know what the person likes, what they don't like, what they've asked for, what size they require, what colors, what brands… (whew!) Know the best gift you can give someone? www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 069 - Back Seat Driver
item.description:
How many of us have encountered the ol' back seat driver?

"You're going too fast!"
"You should've turned there!"
"Hey, you want ME to drive?"

Pretty annoying, huh?
We're like this with the universe, too.

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: How many of us have encountered the ol' back seat driver? "You're going too fast!""You should've turned there!""Hey, you want ME to drive?" Pretty annoying, huh? We're like this with the universe, too. www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 068 - A Gift for You
item.description:
Several dozens shows ago, we talked about an ancient healing technique used by shamans the world over. (Show #24, to be exact)

Here's ANOTHER healing technique from these same shamans.

Think of it as a gift you can give yourself this holiday season.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Several dozens shows ago, we talked about an ancient healing technique used by shamans the world over. (Show #24, to be exact) Here's ANOTHER healing technique from these same shamans. Think of it as a gift you can give yourself this holiday season.

item.title: 067 - Lather, Rinse, Repeat
item.description:
There's a wonderful couple—Jerry and Esther Hicks—who've been teaching the Law of Attraction for many years now.

They're constantly offering up new insights to help us all as we walk our path.

Here's one of my favorite lessons from them.

http://www.abraham-hicks.com/lawofattractionsource/about_hicks.php

http://www.danarossmartin.com/
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: There's a wonderful couple—Jerry and Esther Hicks—who've been teaching the Law of Attraction for many years now. They're constantly offering up new insights to help us all as we walk our path. Here's one of my favorite lessons from them. http://www.abraham-hicks.com/lawofattractionsource/about_hicks.php http://www.danarossmartin.com/

item.title: 066 - Thanks 2 You 4 You
item.description:
Last year at Thanksgiving, we wondered, "Hmm, why just this one day to give thanks; why not every day?" And we all agreed, "Yeah, that would be a good idea, to be thankful every day of the year and not just this one day in November."

But there's more…
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 065 - Fear Not - Part 2
item.description:
Last week we spoke of this advice the shamans have shared with us:

"Don't fear fear."

Here's a corollary to that:

"Do the thing you're afraid to do."

www.danarossmartin.com
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Last week we spoke of this advice the shamans have shared with us: "Don't fear fear." Here's a corollary to that: "Do the thing you're afraid to do." www.danarossmartin.com

item.title: 064 - Fear Not - Part 1
item.description:
Here's something the shamans have always said.

"Don't fear fear."

On this planet, at this time, we have to deal with this thing called fear, but we can, indeed, deal with it, work with it, learn from it, benefit from it and not succumb to it, be drowned in it.

As with all things on earth, there's a reason fear's here.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Here's something the shamans have always said. "Don't fear fear."On this planet, at this time, we have to deal with this thing called fear, but we can, indeed, deal with it, work with it, learn from it, benefit from it and not succumb to it, be drowned in it. As with all things on earth, there's a reason fear's here.

item.title: 063 - U.B.U.
item.description:
I was sitting in meditation the other day when my monkey mind took hold. You know what that is, right?

It's how the ancient Masters referred to our 'everyday mind': "Like a drunken monkey" 

As in,

"all over the place."
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: I was sitting in meditation the other day when my monkey mind took hold. You know what that is, right? It's how the ancient Masters referred to our 'everyday mind': "Like a drunken monkey"  As in, "all over the place."

item.title: 062 - Seek and You Will Find
item.description:
Everything we want in life, everything we're searching for, everything we believe that we need in order to live the life we've imagined for ourselves already exists.

How you find these things is up to you.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Everything we want in life, everything we're searching for, everything we believe that we need in order to live the life we've imagined for ourselves already exists.How you find these things is up to you.

item.title: 061 - Sharing a Secret
item.description:
There's a saying the Hawaiian shamans have which goes:

"Let that which is unknown, be known."

Why keep secrets? 

Aren't we're ALL in this 'experience' together? Shouldn't we ALL have equal access to the Laws of Life?
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: There's a saying the Hawaiian shamans have which goes: "Let that which is unknown, be known." Why keep secrets? Aren't we're ALL in this 'experience' together? Shouldn't we ALL have equal access to the Laws of Life?

item.title: 060 - Five Seconds
item.description:
When you have a moment, try this technique that's been used by Masters the world over for many, many years.

It's not difficult, per se, but to do it for any length of time may prove challenging.

As with anything else, the more you do it, the better you'll become, the easier it'll get.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: When you have a moment, try this technique that's been used by Masters the world over for many, many years. It's not difficult, per se, but to do it for any length of time may prove challenging. As with anything else, the more you do it, the better you'll become, the easier it'll get.

item.title: 059 - When You Die
item.description:
When you're about to die—

When you're on your deathbed and moments away from passing on—

not one of you will say these things.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: When you're about to die—When you're on your deathbed and moments away from passing on—not one of you will say these things.

item.title: 058 - Say This, Not That
item.description:
In each issue, the magazines, Men's Health and Women's Health provide guidance in an ongoing column called, "Eat This, Not That" that teaches which foods are better for us, whether we're shopping at the grocery store or eating in a restuarant.

The shamans have a similar system called, "SAY This, Not That" which teaches that we have a choice with the things we say to ourselves and others.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 057 A-ha!
item.description:
Folks involved in a Near Death Experience always bring back words of wisdom that benefit us all.

Such is the case with Anita Moorjani's account.

http://www.nderf.org/anita_m's_nde.htm
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Folks involved in a Near Death Experience always bring back words of wisdom that benefit us all. Such is the case with Anita Moorjani's account. http://www.nderf.org/anita_m's_nde.htm

item.title: 056 - People and Animals
item.description:
There's an incredible place in Castle Rock, Colorado called PAALS.

"People And Animals Living Synergistically"

Creator Diane Benedict is definitely onto something!

http://www.dogwork.com/anih8/

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-aflfi_gkFQ
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: There's an incredible place in Castle Rock, Colorado called PAALS. "People And Animals Living Synergistically" Creator Diane Benedict is definitely onto something! http://www.dogwork.com/anih8/http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-aflfi_gkFQ

item.title: 055 - Multitasking
item.description:
It's all the rage these days—multitasking.

We've come to the conclusion that the MORE we can do in any given moment:
the MORE we'll accomplish.
the SOONER we'll get ahead of the crowd.
the BETTER a person we'll be.

But that's not true.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: It's all the rage these days—multitasking. We've come to the conclusion that the MORE we can do in any given moment:the MORE we'll accomplish.the SOONER we'll get ahead of the crowd.the BETTER a person we'll be. But that's not true.

item.title: 054 - Just Begin
item.description:
I asked a lot of successful folks:

"What's the most important thing thing you've learned in life that will help the rest of us succeed in life, no matter what our path might be?"

And they all answered:

"Just begin"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: I asked a lot of successful folks: "What's the most important thing thing you've learned in life that will help the rest of us succeed in life, no matter what our path might be?" And they all answered: "Just begin"

item.title: 053 - Nope, Can't Happen
item.description:
Know how when kids get upset, they kick and scream and cry and bang their heads against the floor? And sometimes they even call you names! 

But you don't take it personally. Naw, they're just little kids, lettin' off steam.

That's how God is when you bitch and moan and call Him every name in the book.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 052 - The Clicker
item.description:
You know, just because something is on TV doesn't mean that it's true—doesn't mean that it's good—doesn't mean that it's something you want to spend time watching. 

That's why having a clicker is so great!

There's a clicker for your life, too.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 051 - Be at Peace
item.description:
All computers have DEFAULT settings.

They help the computer go back to square one should things start to go whacko.

We have a DEFAULT setting, too.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: All computers have DEFAULT settings. They help the computer go back to square one should things start to go whacko. We have a DEFAULT setting, too.

item.title: 050 - Who, What, When, Where, and Why
item.description:
In movies, comic books, TV shows and real life, we can always count on the good ol' newspaper reporter  giving us the scoop on what's happenin'. How's this accomplished?

By answering Who, What, When, Where and Why.

Manifesting stuff in our life works this way, too.

Well, sort of.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: In movies, comic books, TV shows and real life, we can always count on the good ol' newspaper reporter  giving us the scoop on what's happenin'. How's this accomplished? By answering Who, What, When, Where and Why. Manifesting stuff in our life works this way, too. Well, sort of.

item.title: 049 - You Are In Charge of You
item.description:
When you're thinking about what you'd like to do with your life—

Whether that be the entire arc of your life or just a particular part of it —

It's always helpful to remember these 2 things:

"Focus on what you want, not what you don't-want." — and—

"YOU are in charge of you."
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 048 - What You're Thinkin', You're Creatin'
item.description:
Pick a time today (doesn't matter when) and observe your thoughts.

Are you worried about something?

Are you angry at someone?

Are you excited about an upcoming event?

It doesn't matter WHAT you're thinking about, no, but know this:

What you're thinkin', you're creatin'
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Pick a time today (doesn't matter when) and observe your thoughts. Are you worried about something? Are you angry at someone? Are you excited about an upcoming event? It doesn't matter WHAT you're thinking about, no, but know this: What you're thinkin', you're creatin'

item.title: 047 - Feed the Things You Want to Grow
item.description:
There are shamans all over the world - incredible men and women who carry on the tradition of teaching the universal laws in story form.

Here's one of my favorites from the American Indian shamans.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: There are shamans all over the world - incredible men and women who carry on the tradition of teaching the universal laws in story form. Here's one of my favorites from the American Indian shamans.

item.title: 046 - Fix You First
item.description:
We've all heard this bit-of-wisdom,

in some form,

at some point in our lifetime:

Ya gotta take care of yourself FIRST, before taking care of others."
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: We've all heard this bit-of-wisdom, in some form, at some point in our lifetime: Ya gotta take care of yourself FIRST, before taking care of others."

item.title: 045 - Choice
item.description:
Really, it all boils down to choice.

No matter what's happening in the world all around you…

you have a choice. 

Listen.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman

item.title: 044 - First in Line
item.description:
I enjoy the long-form type of story, lesson, or joke.

" A shaggy-dog story", some call it.

Here're two.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: I enjoy the long-form type of story, lesson, or joke. " A shaggy-dog story", some call it. Here're two.

item.title: 043 - Try This
item.description:
Early in the morning - BEFORE you get out of bed - even BEFORE you open your eyes - say this to yourself and ponder it awhile.

"My intention today is to be the best me that I can be. And by doing just-that, that's how I'll best-serve the Highest Good."

Not too tough, huh? I mean, just BEING the best you that you can be all day!
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Early in the morning - BEFORE you get out of bed - even BEFORE you open your eyes - say this to yourself and ponder it awhile. "My intention today is to be the best me that I can be. And by doing just-that, that's how I'll best-serve the Highest Good." Not too tough, huh? I mean, just BEING the best you that you can be all day!

item.title: 042 - In & Out Urge
item.description:
There's a great hamburger place on the west coast of the United States called "In & Out Burger" and they make the best stuff!

Not a huge menu. Just hamburgers, chesseburgers, fries, and 'something to drink'. That's it.

Oh, and they also have this free bumper sticker!
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: There's a great hamburger place on the west coast of the United States called "In & Out Burger" and they make the best stuff! Not a huge menu. Just hamburgers, chesseburgers, fries, and 'something to drink'. That's it. Oh, and they also have this free bumper sticker!

item.title: 041 - Fluff
item.description: We are not the clothes we wear. We are not our hair, our bodies, where we live or how much money we have. We may HAVE those things - but we're NOT those things. Those things don't matter. Those things are just fluff.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: We are not the clothes we wear. We are not our hair, our bodies, where we live or how much money we have. We may HAVE those things - but we're NOT those things. Those things don't matter. Those things are just fluff.

item.title: 040 - Look, there's you!
item.description:
"There, but for the grace of God, go I."

We all KNOW that saying, but few of us remember it for any length of time. Actually, it's a pretty powerful statement. It tells you a LOT in a few words & it 'lets you in' on a very important universal secret.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: "There, but for the grace of God, go I." We all KNOW that saying, but few of us remember it for any length of time. Actually, it's a pretty powerful statement. It tells you a LOT in a few words & it 'lets you in' on a very important universal secret.

item.title: 039 Rat Bastards
item.description: Rat bastard. Anyone who hears that term can sorta, on-their-own figure out that a Rat Bastard is a "someone people don't think too fondly of"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Rat bastard. Anyone who hears that term can sorta, on-their-own figure out that a Rat Bastard is a "someone people don't think too fondly of"

item.title: 038 - Past Mistakes
item.description: We've all made mistakes in our past. Big ones, little ones, medium ones. And no matter the SIZE of these past mistakes, we're able to dredge them up and recall them with the greatest of ease. No biggie.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
We've all made mistakes in our past.
Big ones, little ones, medium ones.
And no matter the SIZE of these past mistakes, we're able to dredge them up and recall them with the greatest of ease. No biggie.

item.title: 037 - You Couldn't Be More Perfect
item.description: Last week we spoke about our Number 1 priority in this lifetime: to KNOW who we are! But that's only half of the equation. Once you KNOW who you are, ya gotta BE who you are. (the Divine Creation is counting on you to do just-that)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Last week we spoke about our Number 1 priority in this lifetime:
to KNOW who we are!
But that's only half of the equation.
Once you KNOW who you are, ya gotta BE who you are.
(the Divine Creation is counting on you to do just-that)

item.title: 036 - Number 1 Secret Revealed
item.description: 2011 is the year we finally comprehend the #1 Secret. Well, actually we've known it all along, but we tend to forget. Then, remember again. Then forget. Then remember. (you know, the ol' "lather, rinse, repeat" thing)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
2011 is the year we finally comprehend the #1 Secret.
Well, actually we've known it all along, but we tend to forget.
Then, remember again.
Then forget.
Then remember.
(you know, the ol' "lather, rinse, repeat" thing)

item.title: 035 - (don't) Kill Bill
item.description: We don't OWN any part of this planet. We only BORROW bits-and-pieces of it from lifetime to lifetime. And wishing hurt, harm and death on others doesn't serve us very well either because. . .uh. . .well, karmically-speaking, "What we put out there, we get back"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
We don't OWN any part of this planet. We only BORROW bits-and-pieces of it from lifetime to lifetime.
And wishing hurt, harm and death on others doesn't serve us very well either because. . .uh. . .well, karmically-speaking,
"What we put out there, we get back"

item.title: 034 - St. Anywhere
item.description: Remember when you were growing up and all the 'adults around you' would point towards a church, for example, and remark: "That's where God is, THAT'S where He lives. THAT'S where you go to pray. THERE'S where you can get to God without having to wait in line." (Secret Shaman Hint: He's other places, too)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Remember when you were growing up and all the 'adults around you' would point towards a church, for example, and remark:
"That's where God is, THAT'S where He lives.
THAT'S where you go to pray.
THERE'S where you can get to God without having to wait in line."
(Secret Shaman Hint: He's other places, too)

item.title: 033 - Penny-Thought
item.description: There's an old riddle that goes like this: "Which of these would you choose? 10 million dollars, cash on the table - or – A penny that doubles in value every day for the rest of your life?"
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
There's an old riddle that goes like this:
"Which of these would you choose?
10 million dollars, cash on the table - or – A penny that doubles in value every day for the rest of your life?"

item.title: 032 - Frenemies
item.description: For her new book, "The Twisted Sisterhood", author Kelly Valen talked to thousands of women to find out why 'we tear one another down'. Why all the frenemies? - and - How can we be so GOOD for one another – and yet, so MEAN to one another?
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
For her new book, "The Twisted Sisterhood", author Kelly Valen talked to thousands of women to find out why 'we tear one another down'.
Why all the frenemies? - and - How can we be so GOOD for one another – and yet, so MEAN to one another?

item.title: 031 - Two Things
item.description: Yes, yes, I COULD have drawn a larger crowd by titling this show: "Lose 10 pounds in 10 Minutes!" -or - "Send Me a Dollar and I'll Send You a Million!" But I thought I'd keep it simple . . and honest.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Yes, yes, I COULD have drawn a larger crowd by titling this show:
"Lose 10 pounds in 10 Minutes!"
-or -
"Send Me a Dollar and I'll Send You a Million!"
But I thought I'd keep it simple . . and honest.

item.title: 030 - Wide Open
item.description: Here are two techniques that will help 'eliminate anger' from within you, that will 'dissuade' anger from being felt by you.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary: Here are two techniques that will help 'eliminate anger' from within you, that will 'dissuade' anger from being felt by you.

item.title: 029 - No Biggie
item.description: The Owner's Manual for "how to enjoy this life to the fullest" is not a large book at all. And the lessons are quite easy to comprehend. The reason for this is simple: So that everyone can understand and make full use of this knowledge in their daily lives. We tend to stumble, stutter and hesitate however, when it comes to operating the Manifestation Technique. No biggie. It's fixable.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:

The reason for this is simple: So that everyone can understand and make full use of this knowledge in their daily lives.
We tend to stumble, stutter and hesitate however, when it comes to operating the Manifestation Technique.
No biggie.
It's fixable.

item.title: 028 - Yes
item.description: Start out doing this once-a-day. And you must do it at LEAST once-a-day. (well, in the beginning) Soon, though, you'll tiptoe further and further out on that high diving board. Not because it's scary - but because it's THRILLING!
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Start out doing this once-a-day. And you must do it at LEAST once-a-day.
(well, in the beginning)
Soon, though, you'll tiptoe further and further out on that high diving board.
Not because it's scary - but because it's THRILLING!

item.title: 027 - The Remedy for Everything
item.description: The spiritual teachers on Earth are aware of a "certain something" that's happening to all of us right now. A "certain something" that's going on inside the heart, soul and mind of EVERY being on this planet. We all feel it. (and it doesn't feel that-great)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
The spiritual teachers on Earth are aware of a "certain something" that's happening to all of us right now.
A "certain something" that's going on inside the heart, soul and mind of EVERY being on this planet.
We all feel it.
(and it doesn't feel that-great)

item.title: 026 - Coffee Here Now
item.description: Oh, sure, I'd HEARD it before, but I'd never really HEARD it. Rather, I'd never really GOTTEN it. Here's the way I learned this Universal Law.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Oh, sure, I'd HEARD it before, but I'd never really HEARD it.
Rather, I'd never really GOTTEN it.
Here's the way I learned this Universal Law.

item.title: 025 - The Prayer Prayer
item.description: We all know HOW to pray, but do we know WHY it works the way it does? Why some prayers are answered. . . and most, most-often are not? (it's not a bad thing)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
We all know HOW to pray, but do we know WHY it works the way it does?
Why some prayers are answered. . .
and most, most-often are not?
(it's not a bad thing)

item.title: 024 - A Healing Technique
item.description: Here's one way the shamans help-to-heal and you can do it, too! I'll explain 'how to do it' then I'll provide helpful hints on how to improve your effectiveness while doing this technique.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Here's one way the shamans help-to-heal and you can do it, too!
I'll explain 'how to do it' then I'll provide helpful hints on how to improve your effectiveness while doing this technique.

item.title: 023 - Thanks
item.description: It's almost Thanksgiving here in the good ol' U.S. and that means everyone'll be saying, well, "thanks" on that day. Yes, that's the one day of the year when we all agree to take a moment and give thanks for " . . all that we've been given, Lord. Amen". But what about the other 364 days?
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
It's almost Thanksgiving here in the good ol' U.S. and that means everyone'll be saying, well, "thanks" on that day.
Yes, that's the one day of the year when we all agree to take a moment and give thanks for " . . all that we've been given, Lord. Amen".
But what about the other 364 days?

item.title: 022 - Wake-Up Call
item.description: How many different kinds of ALARMS do we have in our lives? Alarm clocks (of course). Alarms on our cars, ovens, washers, dryers, computers, watches, phones. Alarm systems are EVERWHERE in our lives. The shamans speak of alarms, as well. Alarms that sound 'just for you'.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:

Alarm clocks (of course).
Alarms on our cars, ovens, washers, dryers, computers, watches, phones.
Alarm systems are EVERWHERE in our lives.
The shamans speak of alarms, as well.
Alarms that sound 'just for you'.

item.title: 021 There's a Difference
item.description: A shaman once said to me: "It's easier to hurt someone, than heal them." And, yeah, at the time it DID apprear that way. But then I got to thinkin' . . .

item.itunes:summary:

"It's easier to hurt someone, than heal them."
And, yeah, at the time it DID apprear that way.

item.title: 020 - Fair Trade
item.description: This thought has been thought-before. By millions of folks! It's not a DEEP thought. (actually, it's a NO-brainer) But, putting this thought into action would make a WORLD of difference. I'm just sayin' . . .

By millions of folks!
It's not a DEEP thought.
(actually, it's a NO-brainer)
But, putting this thought into action would make a WORLD of difference.
I'm just sayin' . . .

item.title: 019 Very, Very, Very, Very, Very, Very Important
item.description: It's a waste of your time and energy to worry about how someone else is living their life. It's a waste of your time and energy to be angry at someone for the way they just lived their life. It's a waste of your time and energy to take offense with someone because they're not living life the way YOU think they should. Etcetera, etcetera, etcetera . . .
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
It's a waste of your time and energy to worry about how someone else is living their life.
It's a waste of your time and energy to be angry at someone for the way they just lived their life.
It's a waste of your time and energy to take offense with someone because they're not living life the way YOU think they should.
Etcetera, etcetera, etcetera . . .

item.title: 018 - Picture This
item.description: I'm going to draw a picture for you 'using words'. Rather, I'm going to describe this physical layout to you using language - and from THAT description - you'll draw your OWN picture. Once everyone has this 'picture in their head', well . . . you'll see.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
I'm going to draw a picture for you 'using words'.
Rather, I'm going to describe this physical layout to you using language - and from THAT description - you'll draw your OWN picture.
Once everyone has this 'picture in their head', well . . .
you'll see.

item.title: 017 - One Sentence
item.description: What's your favorite TV commercial jingle or theme song? Yeah, that one. The one you know all the words to by heart. And what's your favorite game or puzzle or "pastime that's just-enough-of-a-challenge but not overly-taxing, physically or otherwise? Okay, now we're going to combine those two talents of yours and get clear on something.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
What's your favorite TV commercial jingle or theme song? Yeah, that one. The one you know all the words to by heart.
And what's your favorite game or puzzle or "pastime that's just-enough-of-a-challenge but not overly-taxing, physically or otherwise?
Okay, now we're going to combine those two talents of yours and get clear on something.

item.title: 016-A Day's Worth of Good
item.description: Pick a time today - a moment - a minute - an hour, if you dare - and focus ONLY on the 'goodness around you'. Then, STAY focused on this 'good stuff' for a long as you can. What about all the other stuff on Earth that's 'NOT-so-good', how do we deal with that? Listen.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Pick a time today - a moment - a minute - an hour, if you dare - and focus ONLY on the 'goodness around you'.
Then, STAY focused on this 'good stuff' for a long as you can.
What about all the other stuff on Earth that's 'NOT-so-good', how do we deal with that?
Listen.

item.title: 015 - Your Future Just Got better
item.description: "Your future is what you're thinking and feeling and saying right now - plus a little bit more." That's all fine and good but - MOST of us - MOST of the time - are usually thinking and feeling and talking about our PAST or FUTURE. The shamans share some helpful insights.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
"Your future is what you're thinking and feeling and saying right now - plus a little bit more."
That's all fine and good but - MOST of us - MOST of the time - are usually thinking and feeling and talking about our PAST or FUTURE.
The shamans share some helpful insights.

item.title: 014 - Spiritual Motivation
item.description: One of my first teachers was this incredible healer. (who also happened to be a shaman) And the folks who came to see him not only experienced a physical healing, but a mental, emotional and spiritual healing as well. Here's why.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
One of my first teachers was this incredible healer. (who also happened to be a shaman)
And the folks who came to see him not only experienced a physical healing, but a mental, emotional and spiritual healing as well.
Here's why.

item.title: 013 - A Whole Bowl of Macaroni
item.description: We all like going on adventures, taking vacations, experiencing new things! But sometimes the weather's bad. Or you have to stand in line. Or people can't understand what you're trying to say. Still, it's a lot of fun, so we keep doing it. More adventures, more vacations, more new things to experience!
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
We all like going on adventures, taking vacations, experiencing new things!
But sometimes the weather's bad. Or you have to stand in line. Or people can't understand what you're trying to say.
Still, it's a lot of fun, so we keep doing it.
More adventures, more vacations, more new things to experience!

item.title: 012 - Go Elsewhere Now
item.description: You're living the life you've always imagined - (whether you CONSCIOUSLY imagined it or not) Your life experience ALWAYS matches the pictures in your head, the feelings in your gut, and the words that you speak.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
You're living the life you've always imagined -
(whether you CONSCIOUSLY imagined it or not)
Your life experience ALWAYS matches the pictures in your head, the feelings in your gut, and the words that you speak.

item.title: 011 - A Door Opens
item.description: We've each been blessed with a gift, a "certain something" that only we can do, oh-so-well. When we give that "gift" to the world, the world responds in kind, giving us all the gifts WE want and need and desire. So, how do we get a piece of this action? It's a little thing, but a big thing.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
We've each been blessed with a gift, a "certain something" that only we can do, oh-so-well.
When we give that "gift" to the world, the world responds in kind, giving us all the gifts WE want and need and desire.
So, how do we get a piece of this action?
It's a little thing, but a big thing.

item.title: 010 - Truth Be Told
item.description: I thought I had the solution to world peace. "When you have the choice of being right or kind, always choose kind."
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
I thought I had the solution to world peace.
"When you have the choice of being right or kind, always choose kind."

item.title: 009 - Manifesting 101
item.description: Two things are rarely mentioned in most "How to Manifest What You Want" classes. Without these 2 things, the Manifestation Equation won't work.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Two things are rarely mentioned in most "How to Manifest What You Want" classes.
Without these 2 things, the Manifestation Equation won't work.

item.title: 008 - Now What?
item.description: All of Creation is like an orchestra playing this magnificent symphony. What part are you supposed to play? (and how do you know WHAT to play?) Part 2 of 2
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
All of Creation is like an orchestra playing this magnificent symphony.
What part are you supposed to play?
(and how do you know WHAT to play?)
Part 2 of 2

item.title: 007 - Play On, Drummer!
item.description: All of Creation is like an orchestra playing this magnificent symphony. How to catch a brief glimpse of God. Live and love and crash and burn and tumble-sideways. Part 1 of 2
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
All of Creation is like an orchestra playing this magnificent symphony.
How to catch a brief glimpse of God.
Live and love and crash and burn and tumble-sideways.
Part 1 of 2

item.title: 006 - Watch What You Say
item.description: Last week we touched on: "Focus on what you want, not what you don't want." - and - "What you think and feel and say is what is created in your life for you." Now that you know that, watch what you say throughout your day.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Last week we touched on:
"Focus on what you want, not what you don't want." - and - "What you think and feel and say is what is created in your life for you."
Now that you know that, watch what you say throughout your day.

item.title: 005 - Cowboy Shaman Mantra
item.description: Create your own mantra. Post it in your living space. Commit it to memory. Above all, stay TRUE to it, LIVE it, BE it. It's a worthwhile thing for ALL of us to do. Here's mine.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Create your own mantra. Post it in your living space. Commit it to memory. Above all, stay TRUE to it, LIVE it, BE it.
It's a worthwhile thing for ALL of us to do.
Here's mine.

item.title: 004 - Stop
item.description: A shamanic technique to change your state of mind. (Yes, anyone can do it.)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
A shamanic technique to change your state of mind.
(Yes, anyone can do it.)

item.title: 003 - Only You
item.description: John Lennon's hand-written lyrics for "A Day in the Life" recently sold at auction for 1.2 million dollars. Picasso's "The Absinthe Drinker" sold for 51.8 million dollars. A Stradivarius violin was purchased for 3.5 million dollars. Britney Spear's chewing gum fetched $263 There's something else that's just as unique and valuable as these items. (well, actually, even MORE so!)
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
John Lennon's hand-written lyrics for "A Day in the Life" recently sold at auction for 1.2 million dollars.
Picasso's "The Absinthe Drinker" sold for 51.8 million dollars.
A Stradivarius violin was purchased for 3.5 million dollars.
Britney Spear's chewing gum fetched $263
There's something else that's just as unique and valuable as these items.
(well, actually, even MORE so!)

item.title: 001 - Teacher Student
item.description: Introductory episode where everyone learns what this podcast is about. A comforting voice. Two old friends, sitting in the back booth at a diner, sharing life-stories over a cup of coffee. A teacher-teaching-teachers.
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Introductory episode where everyone learns what this podcast is about.
A comforting voice.
Two old friends, sitting in the back booth at a diner, sharing life-stories over a cup of coffee.
A teacher-teaching-teachers.

item.title: 002 - All of These
item.description: Kierkegaard said, "Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards." That's the basis for this week's episode of Cowboy Shaman. Well, really, EVERY episode. We best-teach by sharing examples from our own lives. Folks then identify with our experiences, resonate with them and, in turn, learn from them. One of my ongoing life lessons led to this made-up mantra: "In the PAST, I was like this a lot. Now, not so much. But if I DO find myself falling back into my old ways, I change things IMMEDIATELY."
item.dc:creator: Cowboy Shaman
item.itunes:summary:
Kierkegaard said, "Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forwards."
That's the basis for this week's episode of Cowboy Shaman. Well, really, EVERY episode. We best-teach by sharing examples from our own lives. Folks then identify with our experiences, resonate with them and, in turn, learn from them.
One of my ongoing life lessons led to this made-up mantra:
"In the PAST, I was like this a lot. Now, not so much. But if I DO find myself falling back into my old ways, I change things IMMEDIATELY."
